frame.name: Eventive_cognizer_affecting
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Event</fen> causes the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to accept some <fen>Content</fen>. Although the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms an intention, it is not entailed that he/she acts.
<ex><fex name="Event">The divorce</fex> <t>convinced</t> <fex name="Cognizer">him</fex> <fex name="Content">to get help</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Event">The price of a factory reconditioned tool</fex> <t>decided</t> <fex name="Content">it</fex> <fex name="Cognizer">for me</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who perceives the <fen>Event</fen> and changes his or her mind.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root>The new idea that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> accepts as a result of experiencing the <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Event which motivates the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to change his/her mind.
<ex><fex name="Event">The accident</fex> <t>convinced</t> him to drive slower.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s mind is changed.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>) and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is affected by an outside <fen>Event</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: convince.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make an impression on someone so that they believe something.

lexUnit.name: decide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause someone to come to a particular conclusion.
